simplesect.title: netmask6()
simplesect.para: Description: Select only messages sent by a host whose IP address belongs to the specified IPv6 subnet. Note that this filter checks the IP address of the last-hop relay (the host that actually sent the message to &abbrev;), not the contents of the HOST field of the message. You can use both the regular and the compressed format to specify the IP address, for example, 1080:0:0:0:8:800:200C:417A or 1080::8:800:200C:417A. If you do not specify the address, localhost is used. Use the netmask (also called prefix) to specify how many of the leftmost bits of the address comprise the netmask (values 1-128 are valid). For example, the following specify a 60-bit prefix: 12AB:0000:0000:CD30:0000:0000:0000:0000/60 or 12AB::CD30:0:0:0:0/60. Note that if you set an IP address and a prefix, &abbrev; will ignore the bits of the address after the prefix. To filter IPv4 addresses, see .
The netmask6() filter is available in &abbrev; 5.0.8 and 5.2.23.7 and later.

warning.para: If the IP address is not syntactically correct, the filter will never match. The &abbrev; application currently does not send a warning for such configuration errors.
